examples.sentence: いくつ - used mainly for young children
おいくつ - polite, can be used for adults
何歳 (なんさい) - direct, sometimes considered rude for adults

sections.heading: What is いくつ (ikutsu)?
sections.content:
いくつ has two main uses:

"How many" - asking about quantity "How old" - asking about age

いくつありますか？ "How many are there?" いくつですか？ "How old are you?"

children.heading: Basic Pattern
children.content: いくつありますか？ "How many are there?" いくつ買いますか？ "How many will you buy?" いくつ持っていますか？ "How many do you have?" いくつ欲しいですか？ "How many do you want?"

children.heading: With Counters
children.content:
For specific items, use appropriate counters instead of いくつ:

何本 (nanbon) - long objects 何枚 (nanmai) - flat objects 何個 (nanko) - small objects 何人 (nannin) - people りんごはいくつありますか？ ✓ りんごは何個ありますか？ ✓ "How many apples are there?"

children.heading: Age Questions
children.content: いくつですか？ "How old are you?" (casual, for children) おいくつですか？ "How old are you?" (polite) 何歳ですか？ "How old are you?" (more direct)

children.heading: Note on Politeness
children.content: いくつ - used mainly for young children おいくつ - polite, can be used for adults 何歳 (なんさい) - direct, sometimes considered rude for adults

children.heading: Quantity
children.content: Q: いくつありますか？ "How many are there?" A: 3つあります "There are 3" A: 5つです "There are 5" A: たくさんあります "There are many"

children.heading: Age
children.content: Q: いくつですか？ "How old are you?" A: 8歳です "I'm 8 years old" A: 25歳です "I'm 25 years old" A: 30です "I'm 30"

children.heading: いくつか (ikutsuka)
children.content:
"Some/several":

いくつか持っています "I have several" いくつか質問があります "I have some questions" いくつか方法があります "There are several methods"

children.heading: いくつも (ikutsumo)
children.content:
"Many":

いくつも買った "I bought many" いくつも問題がある "There are many problems"

children.heading: Example 1: Counting Objects
children.content: A: りんごはいくつありますか？ "How many apples are there?" B: 5つあります "There are 5" A: もっと欲しいですか？ "Do you want more?" B: いいえ、十分です "No, that's enough"

children.heading: Example 2: Age (Child)
children.content: A: いくつですか？ "How old are you?" B: 7歳です "I'm 7 years old" A: 小学生ですか？ "Are you in elementary school?" B: はい、小学2年生です "Yes, I'm in 2nd grade"

children.heading: Example 3: Shopping
children.content: A: これをいくつ買いますか？ "How many of these will you buy?" B: 3つください "Three please" A: はい、かしこまりました "Yes, certainly"

children.heading: General Counter (つ)
children.content: 1つ (ひとつ) - 1 2つ (ふたつ) - 2 3つ (みっつ) - 3 4つ (よっつ) - 4 5つ (いつつ) - 5 6つ (むっつ) - 6 7つ (ななつ) - 7 8つ (やっつ) - 8 9つ (ここのつ) - 9 10 (とお) - 10

children.heading: Specific Counters
children.content:
When asking about specific items:

ペンは何本ありますか？ "How many pens are there?" 本は何冊ありますか？ "How many books are there?" 人は何人いますか？ "How many people are there?"

children.heading: Polite Age Questions
children.content: おいくつですか？ "How old are you?" (polite) お年はいくつですか？ "What is your age?" (very polite/formal) 失礼ですが、おいくつですか？ "Excuse me, but how old are you?"

children.heading: Avoiding Direct Age Questions
children.content:
In Japanese culture, asking age directly can be impolite. Alternatives:

何年生ですか？ "What grade are you in?" 大学生ですか？ "Are you a university student?" 社会人ですか？ "Are you a working adult?"

children.heading: Mistake 1: Using いくら for quantity
children.content: Wrong: いくらありますか？ (for quantity) ❌ Right: いくつありますか？ ✓ "How many are there?" いくら is for price only!

children.heading: Mistake 2: Using いくつ for adults' age casually
children.content: Less appropriate: いくつですか？ (to adult) ⚠️ Better: おいくつですか？ ✓ Or: 何歳ですか？ ✓ (if acceptable context) "How old are you?"

children.heading: Mistake 3: Wrong counter
children.content: When specific counter needed: Less natural: りんごはいくつ？ ⚠️ More natural: りんごは何個？ ✓ "How many apples?" Both are acceptable, but specific counters sound more natural

children.heading: いくつかの (ikutsuka no)
children.content:
"Some/several" + noun:

いくつかの問題 "several problems" いくつかの方法 "some methods" いくつかの理由 "several reasons"

children.heading: いくつになっても (ikutsu ni nattemo)
children.content:
"No matter how old":

いくつになっても元気 "Energetic no matter how old" いくつになっても学べる "Can learn no matter how old"

children.heading: Casual (Quantity)
children.content: いくつある？ "How many are there?" いくつ欲しい？ "How many do you want?"

children.heading: Polite (Quantity)
children.content: いくつありますか？ "How many are there?" いくつ欲しいですか？ "How many do you want?"

children.heading: Casual (Age - for children)
children.content: いくつ？ "How old?"

children.heading: Polite (Age)
children.content: おいくつですか？ "How old are you?" 何歳でいらっしゃいますか？ "How old are you?" (very polite)

children.heading: Quantity
children.content: いくつありますか？ "How many are there?" いくつ買いますか？ "How many will you buy?" いくつ持っていますか？ "How many do you have?" いくつ欲しいですか？ "How many do you want?"

children.heading: Age
children.content: いくつですか？ "How old are you?" (for children) おいくつですか？ "How old are you?" (polite) お子さんはいくつですか？ "How old is your child?"

children.heading: Expressions
children.content: いくつか質問があります "I have some questions" いくつも買いました "I bought many" いくつかの方法があります "There are several methods"

sections.heading: Related Grammar Points
sections.content: Question Words (5W1H) - Overview Counters - Japanese counting system 何 (nani) - What いくら (ikura) - How much (price) Age expressions - Talking about age Numbers - Japanese number system
